original: Your mother was a hamster and your father smells of elderberries!
translation: 你的母亲带有狐臭！你的父亲必定厄运连连！

original: Judgement day is upon us! The minions of Lucifer walk upon the earth- Oh. No, it is merely the [Root.GetAdjective].
translation: 我们的末日到了！路西法的走狗正在四处流窜——啊，不，原来只是[Root.GetAdjective]啊。

original: Furthermore, I believe that [Root.GetCapital.GetName] must be destroyed!
translation: 另外，我认为我们必须毁掉[Root.GetCapital.GetName]！

original: When the account of our time is written by future generations, they will look at you with that mix of pity and disgust called compassion.
translation: 当后人书写我们这个时代的历史时，想必他们会可怜你们——以及对你们感到恶心。

original: My last visit to the commode was vastly more enjoyable than dinner with the [Root.GetAdjective] ambassador.
translation: 跟[Root.GetAdjective]大使共进晚餐，比去粪池还恶心。

original: Oh look. There's some lovely filth over here.
translation: 快看！那边有一小坨可爱的脏东西！

original: Your blood will make the soil I take from you all the richer.
translation: 你们流的血可使我们从你们那里夺取的土地更肥沃。

original: The [Root.GetAdjective] know nothing about running a state!
translation: [Root.GetAdjective]根本不懂什么叫治国。

original: There is a problem most rife with [Root.GetName], and I suspect the cause are the [Root.Culture.GetName].
translation: [Root.GetName]这个国家全是问题，我怀疑原因是因为你们这些[Root.Culture.GetName]人。

original: In this great game we play, you are a mere pawn.
translation: 在我们下的这局大棋里，你就是一个小卒子。

original: In [From.GetName], '[Root.GetName]' is a word synonymous with manure.
translation: 在[From.GetName]，「[Root.GetName]」跟屎是同义词。

original: Tales of your misdeeds are told from Ireland to Cathay.
translation: 你的恶行从爱尔兰到契丹无人不知，无人不晓。

original: [Root.GetAdjective] culture is something of an oxymoron, don't you think?
translation: [Root.GetAdjective]文化就是种矛盾修辞，你说是吧？

original: May your sky be filled with comets.
translation: 祝贵国满天都是扫把星。

original: No map can be a work of art as long as your nation is on it.
translation: 当你国出现在地图上时，那地图就再也不能称为艺术品了。

original: What are you going to do, bleed on me?
translation: 彼欲何为？欲血溅吾身邪？

original: One day, even [Root.GetAdjective] merchants will understand bookkeeping.
translation: 总有一天，[Root.GetAdjective]的商人会知道该怎么记账。

original: Perhaps my armies should find out if all roads truly lead to Rome.
translation: 也许我的军队应该确认一下是否条条大路通罗马。

original: I've heard your heir enjoys hunting. Do be careful, it would be such a shame if an unforseen accident would happen.
translation: 我听说你的继承人喜欢打猎。 千万要注意安全呀，发生事故的话就太可惜了。

original: Your entire line suffers from delusions of adequacy.
translation: 贵国充斥着不切实际的妄想。

original: So this is where pepper grows? It seems we have arrived just in time for a rich harvest...
translation: 这就是胡椒生长的地方？ 我们好像还赶上了收获季......

original: They say diamonds last forever, and you do seem to have a lot of them. Give us a few and we will find out if they can outlast your dynasty.
translation: 有人说钻石恒久远，而你手头好像有不少钻石。交出来一点，我们会看看这东西是不是比贵国还要长命。

original: It is a dangerous wonder how a heathen such as yourself acquire such a rich and prosperous land. Luckily that will soon be rectified.
translation: 像你们这样的异教徒占据着如此一片富饶的土地真是个危险的奇迹。还好，这马上就会被纠正。

original: Soon all your treasures will be ours, including that preposterous Turquoise chair you so treasure.
translation: 很快你所有的财宝都将归我们所有，包括你那个宝贝绿松石椅。

original: You could have been a fine nation, if you had not been so preoccupied with killing each other over who was more related to the greatest murderer of our time.
translation: 贵国本来可称一时之雄——如果不是你们杀自己人的劲头比这个时代最厉害的杀手还足的话。

original: While we were building a civilization you have kept in hiding among the vagrants of the Deccan. Bow now or meet your end at the hands of the heirs of Timur and Genghis.
translation: 当我们筚路蓝缕开创基业时，你却躲在德干的流浪汉里。现在，向帖木儿及成吉思汗的继业者投降——或者死。

original: We have traveled far and braved many perils to reach your shores. Nothing, however, could prepare us for the hideous sins of your heathen court.
translation: 我们费了好大劲才到达贵国海岸，现在，什么也阻止不了我们来审判你们这些异教徒那罪恶的灵魂了。

original: The [From.GetAdjective] throne shall not be sullied by your cursed and deformed line.
translation: [From.GetAdjective]王座绝不会被受诅咒且扭曲的你国所玷污。

original: You are the scourge of this earth and shall be hanged from your walls for what you've done!
translation: 你就是地球的祸害，你就该因你做的事被吊在你家城墙上示众。

original: You fight like a cow!
translation: 你打仗像个娘们！

original: You fight like a dairy farmer!
translation: 你打仗像个挤奶的！

original: [Root.Monarch.GetName]'s head is as empty as a eunuch's underpants.
translation: [Root.Monarch.GetName]的脑子像太监的内裤一样空洞。

original: l2playnoob!
translation: 菜鸡！

original: Git gud.
translation: 变强点再来，菜鸡 ！

original: O Sultan, Turkish devil and damned devil's kith and kin, secretary to Lucifer himself.
translation: 哦苏丹，土耳其的恶魔，该死的魔鬼的狐朋狗友，路西法他本人的走狗。

original: When our sons look back on today, it will be known that while you may have shaved off our beard, we will remove your arm.
translation: 当我们的后辈回顾今朝时，他们会知道：你们只伤到了我们一点须发，我们却打断了你们的手臂。

original: There is something rotten in the state of Denmark.
translation: 在丹麦某些地方已变得腐败丛生。

original: If [Root.Monarch.GetName] fell into the Thames, that would be a misfortune. But if someone dragged [Root.Monarch.GetHerHim] out again, that would be a calamity.
translation: 如果[Root.Monarch.GetName]掉进泰晤士河，那仅是一次不幸。 但如果有人把[Root.Monarch.GetHerHim]再捞出来，那才是真正的灾难。

original: [Root.Monarch.GetName] is a proud, popish, presumptuous, profane, pestilent, pernicious prelate and usurper.
translation: [Root.Monarch.GetName]是一个自大，可悲，专横，亵渎，险恶，有害的主教和篡位者。

original: Your [Root.Monarch.GetTitle] is an unlawful, unnatural, false, bastardly governor of the Church, the Ordinance of the Devil, petty Pope, anti-Christ, incarnate devil, cozening knave, and prolific liar.
translation: 你这[Root.Monarch.GetTitle]是一个非法的，不自然的，虚假的，卑鄙的国度，充斥着恶魔仪式，伪教皇，反基督，魔鬼化身，蛊惑人心的恶咒以及一大堆骗子。

original: It would be a shame if something were to happen to your Meissner porcelain...
translation: 要是你那些迈斯纳瓷器有什么三长两短，那就太可惜了。

original: Your walls will crumble before our cannon like sand before the sea.
translation: 在我们的大炮面前，你的城墙就像面对海浪的沙子一样脆弱。

original: Your corpse will pave the path of progress, [Root.Monarch.GetName]!
translation: [Root.Monarch.GetName]，你的尸体将铺平我们前进的道路！

original: Is that sorry thing on your head what passes for a crown in [Root.GetName]?
translation: 你头上的那个可笑玩意儿就是[Root.GetName]的王冠？哈？

original: I had another insult prepared for you, but I doubt you would be able to read it.
translation: 我又为你准备了另一条粗鄙之语，但我怀疑你是否能读懂。

original: It is time for the sun to set on the British empire.
translation: 日不落帝国是时候落日了。

original: May you be sewn up alive in the belly of a dead camel.
translation: 祝您被活活缝进死骆驼的肚子里。

original: I suggest you change your uniform trousers to brown.
translation: 我建议你把制服裤子改成棕色。

original: Does [Root.Consort.GetName] know how many hand-maidens you keep in your chambers?
translation: [Root.Consort.GetName]是否知道你房间里藏了多少婊子？

original: You are neither holy, nor Roman, nor an Empire.
translation: 你国既不神圣，也不罗马，更非帝国。

original: Your eagle has two heads but not even one crown.
translation: 你打着双头鹰旗，却一顶王冠也没有。

original: It is time you left.
translation: 你该滚了。

original: Not even seppuku could restore your honor.
translation: 即使是切腹也无法恢复你的荣誉。

original: The dreadful state of your economy is a warning to all would-be rulers.
translation: 你们经济的惨状是对所有未来统治者的警示。

original: I hear your people are revolting. You have that in common.
translation: 我听说贵国百姓在造反，真是有其君必有其民。

original: Can your soldiers hit a barn yet, or do they still think muskets are clubs?
translation: 你的士兵能打中谷仓吗？还是说他们仍然把步枪当成棍子使？

original: You upstart tax collectors should know your place; being trampled under our horses!
translation: 你们这些暴发户应该明白你们的下场——被我们的马踩死！

original: We will impale [Root.Monarch.GetName] on a spike, as we have done with your pathetic armies.
translation: 我们会把[Root.Monarch.GetName]的头钉在矛尖上，就像我们对你们那可怜的军队所做的那样。

original: You have haunted the waters of the Mediterranean for too long, cursed pirate!
translation: 你已经祸害地中海水域太久了，可恶的海盗！

original: You truly are the Sultan of Rum, you drunken swine!
translation: 你真是朗姆国的苏丹，你这醉鬼！

original: Your kingdom is truly worth only a horse.
translation: 贵国的价值仅与一匹马相当。

original: We shall take your lives, and your freedom!
translation: 我们将夺走你的生命，还有你的自由！

original: May you succumb to Samsara and live a thousand lives without joy or enlightenment.
translation: 愿你在不悦与蒙昧中轮回千世。

original: Our arrows will blot out the sun!
translation: 我们的弓箭将遮天蔽日！

original: I hear that [Root.Monarch.GetName] is a devout follower of the [Root.religion.GetName], which will decide [From.Monarch.GetHerHis] fate in the next life. But it is the Emperor who will decide your fate in this life.
translation: 吾闻[Root.Monarch.GetName]耽于[Root.religion.GetName]甚矣。[From.Monarch.GetHerHis]来世如何，区区神灵尚可指摘，尔等今生若何，却在吾皇股掌之间！

original: Show your obedience to the Emperor and enjoy a happy life, or else you shall meet the Celestial Army!
translation: 朝于天子，许尔述职。不朝，六师移之！

original: Your misdeeds so far are nothing but a petty sore. Correct them before they become infected beyond the point of help.
translation: 到目前为止，你们所搞的破坏也不过是一点小小的疥疮，我们会在感染扩大到无法控制之前把它治好的。

original: Do you have a flag?
translation: 你们有国旗吗？

original: Listen, strange women lying in ponds distributing swords is no basis for a system of government. Supreme executive power derives from a mandate from the masses, not from some farcical aquatic ceremony.
translation: 听着，躺在池塘里送上剑的奇怪女人（指湖中剑的典故）并不能成为国家统治权的来源。统治权来自人民，而非某些滑稽的水上仪式。

original: What did you just say to me, you scallywag? I have sailed the seven seas and have over a hundred confirmed boardings.
translation: 饭桶！你刚刚跟我说什么？我远航七海，足登百舰。

original: I will rain grapeshot all over you and you will choke on it. You're sunk, you blackguard.
translation: 我要用霰弹把你打成筛子，让你被弹丸和鲜血窒息。淹死吧，你这恶棍！

original: If you keep on drinking rum, the world will soon be quit of a very dirty scoundrel!
translation: 要是你能一直这样喝朗姆酒，这个世界就能摆脱一个肮脏的恶棍了！

original: I once owned a dog that was smarter than you
translation: 我养过一条比你聪明的狗

original: I give you a choice. You can be gutted, or decapitated!
translation: 我给你两个选择，被剖腹，或是被斩首！

original: It is true, I admit, that [Root.GetName] is of greater extent than [From.GetName]. But you must agree that [From.Monarch.GetName] rules over men, while [Root.GetName] rules only over forests and mosquitoes.
translation: 这点我得承认，[Root.GetName]的确比[From.GetName]拥有更加广阔的领土。但你也得承认，[From.Monarch.GetName]统治着人类，而[Root.GetName]统治的都是森林和蚊子！
